body.p: MSS. Ch. Bucks. 1-94, Rolls Bucks. 1-2 represent the collection catalogued in 1878. The 1878 catalogue divides the collection between Ravenstone Priory (Ch. 1-37), Notley or Nutley Abbey (Ch. 38-43), Tickford Priory ('34-44' - 60), and charters of unstated provenance. The three priories were part of the endowment of Christ Church; the documents in the present collection were acquired by Anthony Wood and given by him to the Bodleian. Related documents, originally part of the same archives, are in D. D. Ch. Ch. M.

The major later accessions are as follows:
Ch. 126-712: leases of New College Oxford property, bought from William Parker, 1884 (S.C. V.635), some possibly given by John Greville Chester (S.C. V.654): other documents in this accession are now referenced as MSS. Ch. Berks. 296-493, Ch. Cambs. 72-146, Ch. Essex 266b-972, Ch. Glouc. 45-134, Ch. Hants. 23-177, Ch. Kent 251-284, Ch. Lincs. 138-181, Ch. London and Middlesex 226-325, Ch. Norf. 764-825, Ch. Northants. 24-26, Ch. Oxon. 1068-2406, Ch. Sussex 327, Ch. Wilts. 40-211, Ch. Misc. 536.
Ch. 834-867: 13th-century documents relating to Hartwell
Ch. 882-1318: Thoresby Park deeds, purchased (?) from Lord Maners 1942.
Ch. 1324-1408: documents relating to Hartwell, Stone etc., purchased from Halliday, 1941.
Not included in the present catalogue are the 19th-century Wykeham family documents relating to Towersey (Ch. 1473-1509)
